result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:40 PM Defendant Timothy L Hoeller in court.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Timothy L Hoeller.  Attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for contested competency hearing.
State calls Dr. Jenna Niess to testify by Zoom (video).  Dr. Niess sworn in and testified on direct examination, cross examination and judicial inquiry.  Exhibits 1 and 2 marked, offered and received by the Court.
State rests.
Defense rests.
Arguments by the State.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court finds the defendant not competent but likely to regain competency.
Court orders the defendant committed to the Department of Health and Human Services for treatment.
Court orders the involuntary administration of medication.
Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff pending transportation to the appropriate facility.
Defense requests a date for the De Novo Motion to Dismiss.  
Parties agree the defendant does not need to be present for the Motion to Dismiss.

Review hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.

The Court notes that attorney Crawford has requests a de novo review infront of the Trial Court.
DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
The Court will adjourn both the De Novo hearing for Motion to Dismiss and Review of Competency.  Review hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

De Novo motion to dismiss - sent to CC Costello for review. Court's response 6/09:  Prelim. date remains on due to Marsy's law. Defense waited a month to ask for the de novo review. If Judge Lau cannot hear the de novo prior to the prelim date, the 6/20 date will convert to status with parties to appear in person.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Motion hearing on April 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.

01:01 PM Defendant Timothy L Hoeller appeared by Zoom with attorney Paul S. Crawford who appeared by Zoom.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Attorney Crawford is waiving time limits and asking to schedule this matter for a motion hearing as he intends on filing a motion to dismiss.  No objection by the State.  The Court will set this matter for a motion hearing to address Attorney Crawford's motion to dismiss.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
01:20 PM Defendant Timothy L Hoeller in court.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Court notes that the Defendant file an motion to extend the time frame to hire an attorney.
The Defendant requests 90 day extension. 
The Court denies the request for the 90 day extension and places its reasons on the record.
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing April 1, 2022.
ADA Brejcha presents statements that in the voluminous filings that the Defendant is filing he is identifying the victims in the case which is a violation of bond conditions and requests the Court admonish the Defendant.
The Court admonishes the Defendant and orders the Defendant to utilize the victim ID key that was provided at the initial appearance.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court will adjourn the matter for Status of Counsel.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR VIA ZOOM FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.  Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
